questions.question: What does it mean to 'compare' two things?
options: To show how they are different
To show how they are the same
To tell a story about them
questions.correct_answer: To show how they are the same

questions.question: What does it mean to 'contrast' two things?
options: To show how they are different
To show how they are the same
questions.correct_answer: To show how they are different

questions.question: Which word is a signal word for comparing?
Which word is a signal word for contrasting?
The sentence 'Apples and oranges are both fruits' is an example of...
The sentence 'A dog is a mammal, but a lizard is a reptile' is an example of...
What is the main purpose of a compare and contrast essay?
options: To describe one thing in great detail
To show the similarities and differences between two or more things
To argue that one thing is the best
questions.correct_answer: To show the similarities and differences between two or more things

questions.question: The word 'like' is often used to...
The word 'unlike' is used to...
If you are writing about how two friends are the same, you are...
If you write about how a village is different from a city, you are...
Which of these shows a comparison? 'A cat, ______ a dog, is a popular pet.'
Which of these shows a contrast? 'Winter is cold, ______ summer is hot.'
The first step in writing a compare and contrast essay is to...
A Venn diagram is a good tool for...
options: planning a compare and contrast essay
questions.correct_answer: planning a compare and contrast essay

questions.question: In a Venn diagram, where do you write the similarities?
The word 'both' is used to show...
The phrase 'on the other hand' is used to show...
If two things are 'alike', they are...
If two things are 'different', they are...
To write about things two subjects have in common, you should look for...
Which question asks you to compare? 'How are a bus and a train ______?'
Which question asks you to contrast? 'What is the main ______ between a city and a village?'
'Both a car and a bicycle have wheels.' This sentence...
options: Contrasts a car and a bicycle
Compares a car and a bicycle
questions.correct_answer: Compares a car and a bicycle

questions.question: 'A car runs on fuel, whereas a bicycle runs on human power.' This sentence...
options: Contrasts a car and a bicycle
Compares a car and a bicycle
questions.correct_answer: Contrasts a car and a bicycle

questions.question: The word 'also' is used to...
The phrase 'in contrast' is used to...
What is the most important part of a compare and contrast essay?
options: A clear purpose for the comparison
questions.correct_answer: A clear purpose for the comparison

questions.question: When you compare two books, you might discuss their...
A compare and contrast essay needs an introduction, body, and...
Which pair of words is used for comparing?
options: on the one hand, on the other hand

questions.question: Which pair of words is used for contrasting?
To compare means to find things that are...
To contrast means to find things that are...
The introduction of a compare and contrast essay should...
options: introduce the two subjects and the main point
questions.correct_answer: introduce the two subjects and the main point

questions.question: 'Apples are red. In the same way, some cherries are red.' This is a...
'He is tall. On the other hand, his brother is short.' This is a...
What is the purpose of brainstorming before writing?
The conclusion of your essay should...
options: summarize the main points of comparison
questions.correct_answer: summarize the main points of comparison

questions.question: The word 'likewise' indicates a...
The word 'although' often introduces a...
Comparing a book and a movie based on the book is a common type of...
The body paragraphs should provide ______ for your points of comparison and contrast.
You can compare two ______ to see which one you want to visit.
The phrase 'as well as' is used for...
The word 'yet' can be used to show a...
To write a good essay, your points of comparison must be...
What is the main idea of a compare and contrast essay stated in the introduction?
'Both subjects are interesting.' This is a...
'One is easy, while the other is difficult.' This is a...
What are the two main organizational structures for a compare and contrast essay?
In the 'Block Method', you discuss...
options: one point about both subjects at a time
all of subject A, then all of subject B
questions.correct_answer: all of subject A, then all of subject B

questions.question: In the 'Point-by-Point Method', you discuss...
options: all of subject A, then all of subject B
one point of comparison at a time for both subjects
questions.correct_answer: one point of comparison at a time for both subjects

questions.question: A strong thesis statement for a compare and contrast essay should not just state that there are similarities and differences, but also...
options: make a meaningful point about them
questions.correct_answer: make a meaningful point about them

questions.question: Which of these is the BEST thesis statement? 'While both villages and cities provide a place to live, villages offer a stronger sense of community.'
options: This is a good thesis statement.
This is not a thesis statement.
questions.correct_answer: This is a good thesis statement.

questions.question: The phrase 'on the contrary' is a strong transition for...
What is the purpose of the 'basis of comparison'?
options: It is the main argument of the essay.
It refers to the specific points or criteria you are using to compare and contrast.
It is the conclusion of the essay.
It is the title of the essay.
questions.correct_answer: It refers to the specific points or criteria you are using to compare and contrast.

questions.question: If you are comparing two poems, which of these would be a good basis for comparison?
options: The number of words in each poem
The color of the book they were printed in
The use of imagery and theme
questions.correct_answer: The use of imagery and theme

questions.question: The point-by-point method is often better for ______ essays.
The block method can be effective for ______ essays where the goal is to give a whole picture of each subject.
An essay that argues that one subject is superior to another, based on a comparison, is both a compare/contrast and a ______ essay.
The transition word 'conversely' indicates...
The phrase 'in a like manner' indicates...
To avoid a boring essay, you should not just list similarities and differences, but also...
options: use a lot of difficult words

questions.question: If you use the block method, what is a potential risk you need to avoid?
options: The essay will be too integrated.
The two sections will seem like two separate essays.
The essay will be too short.
The reader will be too engaged.
questions.correct_answer: The two sections will seem like two separate essays.

questions.question: What is the function of the sentence: 'Despite these differences, both characters are seeking a sense of belonging.'?
options: To transition from discussing differences to discussing similarities
questions.correct_answer: To transition from discussing differences to discussing similarities

questions.question: The thesis statement in a compare and contrast essay serves as a ______ for the entire paper.
When comparing online learning and traditional learning, a key point of contrast would be...
The word 'disparate' means...
The word 'analogous' means...
To maintain a balanced essay, you should...
options: give equal attention to both subjects
questions.correct_answer: give equal attention to both subjects

questions.question: What is wrong with the thesis: 'This essay will compare and contrast cars and bicycles.'?
options: It is too obvious and doesn't make an interesting point.
questions.correct_answer: It is too obvious and doesn't make an interesting point.

questions.question: The conclusion of a compare and contrast essay should synthesize the information to...
options: show the reader the significance of the comparison
questions.correct_answer: show the reader the significance of the comparison

questions.question: The main advantage of the point-by-point method is that it...
options: creates a more direct and integrated comparison
focuses on one subject at a time
questions.correct_answer: creates a more direct and integrated comparison

questions.question: What does it mean to make an 'analogy'?
options: To show that two things are identical
To explain a complex idea by comparing it to a simpler, more familiar one
To list the differences between two things
To tell a story about two things
questions.correct_answer: To explain a complex idea by comparing it to a simpler, more familiar one

questions.question: 'A city is to a country as a leaf is to a tree.' This is an example of a/an...
A balanced conclusion should touch upon...
options: both the key similarities and differences
questions.correct_answer: both the key similarities and differences

questions.question: Which of these is a good transition for a paragraph about differences, following a paragraph about similarities?
When comparing two characters, focusing on their motivations would be a...
The phrase 'a key distinction is' introduces a...
To ensure fairness in your essay, you should avoid...
options: showing bias toward one subject unless it's a persuasive essay
questions.correct_answer: showing bias toward one subject unless it's a persuasive essay

questions.question: If you are comparing two historical events, what is a crucial element to consider?
options: The historical context of each event
The colors associated with each event
Your personal feelings about the events
Only the dates of the events
questions.correct_answer: The historical context of each event

questions.question: The phrase 'at the same time' can be used to introduce a...
What is the function of supporting details in a compare/contrast paragraph?
options: To provide evidence for the point of comparison or contrast
questions.correct_answer: To provide evidence for the point of comparison or contrast

questions.question: A successful compare and contrast essay helps the reader...
options: see two subjects in a new or clearer way
questions.correct_answer: see two subjects in a new or clearer way

questions.question: The block method is also known as the ______ method.
The point-by-point method is also known as the ______ method.
A thesis statement that says 'Cats and dogs are similar in some ways and different in others' is...
options: a good example of a thesis
weak because it is too obvious
questions.correct_answer: weak because it is too obvious

questions.question: Which transition shows a similarity?
Which transition shows a difference?
It is important that the points you compare and contrast are ______ for both subjects.
If your essay's purpose is to show that one option is better, your thesis should...
options: state that they are both the same
clearly state which one is superior and why
not mention which is better until the conclusion
questions.correct_answer: clearly state which one is superior and why

questions.question: A comparison becomes more insightful when it reveals a ______ similarity between two seemingly different things.
The body of a compare and contrast essay must be directly related to the...
A good conclusion might emphasize the ______ of the comparison.
When comparing two novels, discussing the authors' use of symbolism is a...
The conclusion should provide a sense of...
Using a Venn diagram helps you visually ______ your points before writing.
The two subjects of your essay must have enough ______ to justify a comparison.
The 'synthesis' that happens in the conclusion is about...
options: bringing the compared points together to form a larger insight
questions.correct_answer: bringing the compared points together to form a larger insight

questions.question: What is the primary weakness of the block method for a complex, multi-faceted comparison?
options: The reader may forget the details of Subject A by the time they are reading about Subject B.
It is only suitable for persuasive essays.
It does not allow for a thesis statement.
questions.correct_answer: The reader may forget the details of Subject A by the time they are reading about Subject B.

questions.question: A sophisticated thesis for a compare and contrast essay often aims to...
options: prove that two things are identical
challenge a common assumption about the relationship between two subjects
list as many differences as possible
questions.correct_answer: challenge a common assumption about the relationship between two subjects

questions.question: What is the function of a 'basis of comparison'?
options: To ensure a fair and logical comparison by using consistent criteria for both subjects.
To introduce bias into the essay.
To provide a historical context only.
To act as the essay's conclusion.
questions.correct_answer: To ensure a fair and logical comparison by using consistent criteria for both subjects.

questions.question: How does an analogy differ from a simple comparison?
options: An analogy is a brief comparison, while a simple comparison is extended.
An analogy primarily aims to explain a complex or abstract relationship by relating it to a more familiar one.
questions.correct_answer: An analogy primarily aims to explain a complex or abstract relationship by relating it to a more familiar one.

questions.question: A 'false analogy' is a logical fallacy where...
options: a comparison is made between two things that are not alike in relevant aspects
a comparison is used to explain a concept clearly
two things are shown to be identical
a strong conclusion is drawn from a comparison
questions.correct_answer: a comparison is made between two things that are not alike in relevant aspects

questions.question: When comparing two different historical periods, it is crucial to avoid 'presentism', which is the act of...
options: analyzing the past in its own context
interpreting the past with modern-day attitudes and beliefs
questions.correct_answer: interpreting the past with modern-day attitudes and beliefs

questions.question: In a critical literary comparison, the essay should move beyond surface-level observations to analyze how similarities and differences...
options: create meaning or affect the reader's interpretation
are listed on the book's cover
questions.correct_answer: create meaning or affect the reader's interpretation

questions.question: A nuanced compare and contrast essay often concludes that...
options: one subject is completely good and the other is completely bad
the two subjects are exactly the same
the relationship between the subjects is complex, with no simple answer
questions.correct_answer: the relationship between the subjects is complex, with no simple answer

questions.question: The point-by-point structure is generally more effective for developing a/an...
The phrase 'A is a foil to B' means that...
options: character A's qualities contrast with character B's, highlighting B's traits more clearly.
A and B are best friends.
A is the main character and B is the villain.
questions.correct_answer: character A's qualities contrast with character B's, highlighting B's traits more clearly.

questions.question: A successful synthesis in a conclusion should...
options: repeat the thesis statement word for word
go beyond summarizing to show the broader implications of the comparison
introduce a new piece of evidence
questions.correct_answer: go beyond summarizing to show the broader implications of the comparison

questions.question: When comparing two solutions to a problem, the most important criterion for evaluation is usually...
A sophisticated transition between points in a compare and contrast essay will not just signal a shift, but also...
options: explain the logical relationship between the points
questions.correct_answer: explain the logical relationship between the points

questions.question: An essay that compares a book's narrative with its film adaptation should primarily focus on...
options: the choices made in adapting the story and their effects on theme and character
the box office revenue of the film
questions.correct_answer: the choices made in adapting the story and their effects on theme and character

questions.question: What is the purpose of using a 'concession' in a persuasive compare and contrast essay?
options: To admit that your argument is weak.
To acknowledge a minor point of the opposing view, which adds credibility to your overall argument.
questions.correct_answer: To acknowledge a minor point of the opposing view, which adds credibility to your overall argument.

questions.question: The phrase 'juxtaposition of ideas' in writing means...
options: placing two concepts side-by-side to highlight their similarities or differences
explaining one idea in great detail
questions.correct_answer: placing two concepts side-by-side to highlight their similarities or differences

questions.question: In a compare and contrast essay about two political ideologies, the writer must strive for...
options: objectivity and the use of neutral language
questions.correct_answer: objectivity and the use of neutral language

questions.question: What is a potential pitfall of the point-by-point method?
options: It can feel mechanical or repetitive if not handled with good transitions.
It makes the reader forget the first subject.
It is only good for short essays.
questions.correct_answer: It can feel mechanical or repetitive if not handled with good transitions.

questions.question: A strong compare/contrast thesis often evaluates the subjects, arguing that one is more significant or effective based on...
How can an analogy be an effective persuasive tool?
options: By linking a complex argument to a simpler, emotionally resonant situation.
By confusing the audience with an irrelevant comparison.
questions.correct_answer: By linking a complex argument to a simpler, emotionally resonant situation.

questions.question: What does a 'diachronic' comparison involve?
options: Comparing two different things at the same point in time.
Comparing the same thing at different points in time.
questions.correct_answer: Comparing the same thing at different points in time.

questions.question: What does a 'synchronic' comparison involve?
options: Comparing two different things at the same point in time.
Comparing the same thing at different points in time.
Analyzing something over a long historical period.
questions.correct_answer: Comparing two different things at the same point in time.

questions.question: The most sophisticated compare and contrast essays often conclude by...
options: synthesizing the findings to propose a new idea or a more nuanced understanding
stating that the comparison was pointless
questions.correct_answer: synthesizing the findings to propose a new idea or a more nuanced understanding

questions.question: When comparing two texts, it is important to go beyond plot summary and analyze...
options: the font used in the book

questions.question: What is the function of a 'bridge' in a compare and contrast essay, especially when using the block method?
options: A sentence or phrase that connects the discussion of Subject A to the discussion of Subject B.
The main point of the essay.
questions.correct_answer: A sentence or phrase that connects the discussion of Subject A to the discussion of Subject B.

questions.question: A comparison of 'freedom' in two different philosophical systems requires the writer to first...
options: provide a clear, operational definition of 'freedom' for the essay
assume everyone has the same definition
questions.correct_answer: provide a clear, operational definition of 'freedom' for the essay

questions.question: In a formal academic essay, what is the best way to handle obvious similarities?
options: Focus the entire essay on them.
Acknowledge them briefly and then focus on more complex or surprising comparisons.
Make them the main point of your thesis.
questions.correct_answer: Acknowledge them briefly and then focus on more complex or surprising comparisons.

questions.question: What is the main risk of choosing two subjects that are too similar?
options: The essay will be too long.
The comparison may become a simple list with no interesting argument.
The conclusion will be too strong.
The reader will be very surprised.
questions.correct_answer: The comparison may become a simple list with no interesting argument.

questions.question: What is the main risk of choosing two subjects that are too different?
options: The essay will be too easy to write.
The comparison might feel forced and lack a meaningful basis.
The thesis statement will be too clear.
questions.correct_answer: The comparison might feel forced and lack a meaningful basis.

questions.question: A successful compare and contrast essay must demonstrate which key academic skill?
To avoid a 'so what?' thesis, your main point should answer the question of...
options: why the comparison is important or what it reveals
questions.correct_answer: why the comparison is important or what it reveals

questions.question: The level of detail in your comparison should be dictated by...
options: the length requirement of the essay
the complexity of your thesis and the needs of your audience
how much you like each subject
questions.correct_answer: the complexity of your thesis and the needs of your audience

questions.question: What does it mean to provide a 'balanced' treatment in a compare and contrast essay?
options: Giving equal space and depth of analysis to both subjects.
Making sure the number of similarities and differences is exactly the same.
Writing the same number of words for each paragraph.
Focusing only on the positive aspects.
questions.correct_answer: Giving equal space and depth of analysis to both subjects.

questions.question: The use of 'whereas' in a sentence signals a...
options: contrast that often balances two equal points
questions.correct_answer: contrast that often balances two equal points

questions.question: An evaluative compare and contrast essay does what?
options: It simply lists similarities and differences.
It judges which of the two subjects is better based on set criteria.
It tells a story about the two subjects.
It describes the two subjects separately.
questions.correct_answer: It judges which of the two subjects is better based on set criteria.

questions.question: When comparing two artworks, a formal analysis would focus on elements like...
The purpose of comparing is not just to find sameness, but to...
The purpose of contrasting is not just to find differences, but to...
A 'straw man' argument in a compare/contrast essay would involve...
options: misrepresenting one subject to make the other look better
questions.correct_answer: misrepresenting one subject to make the other look better

questions.question: What is the key to successfully using the block method?
options: A strong concluding paragraph that ties the two sections together.
Making the first section much longer than the second.
Using different criteria for each subject.
Never referring back to the first subject in the second section.
questions.correct_answer: A strong concluding paragraph that ties the two sections together.

questions.question: A sophisticated introduction might begin with a general statement, narrow down to the subjects, and then present the...
The 'apples and oranges' problem in compare and contrast writing refers to...
options: comparing two things that are too similar
comparing two things that have no valid basis for comparison
questions.correct_answer: comparing two things that have no valid basis for comparison

questions.question: To write an effective compare and contrast essay, you must move beyond mere description and into...
A comparison that reveals the 'evolution' of an idea would be best structured...
In a formal essay, the transition 'while' is best used to...
The conclusion of a highly effective compare/contrast essay might do what?
options: Introduce a third subject for comparison.
Propose a synthesis or new understanding that arises from the comparison.
End with a question that has no answer.
questions.correct_answer: Propose a synthesis or new understanding that arises from the comparison.

questions.question: What is a 'qualitative' comparison?
options: A comparison based on numbers and statistics.
A comparison based on qualities, characteristics, and interpretations.
A comparison that is very short.
questions.correct_answer: A comparison based on qualities, characteristics, and interpretations.

questions.question: What is a 'quantitative' comparison?
options: A comparison based on numbers, data, and measurable quantities.
A comparison based on feelings and opinions.
A comparison that is very long.
questions.correct_answer: A comparison based on numbers, data, and measurable quantities.

questions.question: A sophisticated writer uses comparison and contrast not as an end in itself, but as a tool to...
options: make a larger point or argument
questions.correct_answer: make a larger point or argument

questions.question: Choosing to compare two seemingly unrelated items can be a high-risk but high-reward strategy if you can...
options: prove they are actually the same
establish a surprising but insightful basis for comparison
use a lot of difficult words
questions.correct_answer: establish a surprising but insightful basis for comparison
